summary: This is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the processing of digital evidence in the Epstein case. The sender follows up on a call about a hard drive containing files from seven devices, noting discrepancies in the inventory spreadsheet. The email references FBI forensic examiners and the transfer of evidence to a vendor for processing.

persons.name: Atilinifel
persons.context: Appears as the primary recipient (To:) of the follow-up email regarding device processing.

persons.name: Ma:ntCalEfill
persons.context: Appears as a CC recipient on the follow-up email, likely involved in the evidence handling process.

persons.name: Im, a (NY) (FBI)
persons.role: FBI Senior Forensic Examiner / CART Coordinator
persons.context: Sent the original email with the spreadsheet, identifying themselves as the NYO CART Coordinator and Senior Forensic Examiner. They discuss the status of evidence processing and transfer.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding the transfer and processing of digital evidence, indicating a working relationship on the case.

events.title: Spreadsheet and evidence status email
events.description: FBI Senior Forensic Examiner sends an email with a spreadsheet detailing evidence status, noting most items are at 'Southern' and discussing remaining devices to process.

events.title: Follow-up on device discrepancies
events.description: Email follow-up regarding discrepancies in the evidence spreadsheet for seven devices, noting oddities in the inventory and planning to send folders to a vendor for processing.

keyFacts: Seven devices with NYC evidence numbers (NYC024363, NYC024392, NYC024328, NYC024365, NYC024366, NYC024371, NYC024383) were identified from a hard drive and were being sent to a vendor for processing into platform-readable files.
Discrepancies were noted in the evidence spreadsheet: NYC024392 was listed as 'not yet ready' but was received, and NYC024328 was not listed on the spreadsheet at all.
The correspondence is subject to a protective order (paragraphs 7, 8, 9, 10, 15, and 17), indicating sensitive or restricted information related to the Epstein case investigation.
